title: 2.29 - ऋजु-गति का काल
arth: [ अविग्रहा ] विग्रहरहित गति [ एकसमया ] एक समय मात्र ही होती है अर्थात्‌ उसमें एक समय ही लगता है।
meaning: Movement without a bend is for one instant (samaya).
vyakhya: बिना मोडे वाली गति में एक समय लगता है। इसी को ऋजुगति कहते हैं।
explanation:
That movement that takes one instant is ‘ekasamayā’. The movement without a bend is ‘avigraha’. The soul and the matter impelled by movement takes only one instant even to reach the end of the universe, if there be no impediment – vyāghāta.

It is said that in the beginningless convention of karmic bondage, the soul, owing to its wrong-faith, etc., takes in karmic matter at all times. Does the soul take in matter during its passage from one birth to another?
